answers.text:
Hello, Roger.  I found some resources that might get you started on developing a policy that will work best for your community:
This is an ICMA recommended document describing several different public-private partnerships for the use of public facilities:
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/302938/Parks_and_Recreation_Departments_Partner_with_Local_Organizations_and_Everyone_Wins
This document from the Knowledge Network creates a system that will help discount facility use for various groups that provide value to the community:
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/303655/Affiliated_User_Guidelines
This is a document outlining who may use city hall and under what circumstances, including a small section on which groups have to pay and which don’t:
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/6731/Public_Use_of_City_Hall
I also found this website which has a large number of sources.  You might find help in the General Policies section:
http://www.mrsc.org/subjects/parks/comcen.aspx#rules
Gabriel Brehm
Knowledge Network Intern
ICMA

author: Roger Kolman
text: Does anyone have a policy on the use of public facilities/services? Specifically, a policy that addresses who will or will not have to pay for the use of those facilities/services and who (council or administration) makes that decision?
title: Use of public facilities/services
